recipe.ingredients: - cauliflower: 1 large head (about 6 cups riced) - egg: 1 large - mozzarella cheese (shredded): 1 cup - Parmesan cheese (grated): 1/4 cup - Italian seasoning: 1 teaspoon - salt: 1/2 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon - olive oil: 1 tablespoon (for greasing) - pizza sauce (sugar-free): 1/2 cup - bell peppers (sliced): 1/2 cup - onions (sliced): 1/4 cup - mushrooms (sliced): 1/4 cup - olives (sliced): 1/4 cup - additional mozzarella cheese (topping): 1/2 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Cauliflower: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the stems and leaves from the cauliflower and chop the florets into chunks. Place them in a food processor and pulse it until the texture of rice. 2. Cook Cauliflower: Transfer the riced cauliflower to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 5 minutes. Let it cool, then squeeze out all the excess moisture with a tea towel. 3. Make Dough: In a bowl, combine the cooked cauliflower with 1 egg, 1 cup mozzarella, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, salt, and black pepper. Mix well. 4. Shape and Bake Crust: Line a pizza tray or a baking sheet with parchment paper and grease it with olive oil. Press the cauliflower mixture into a round shape to create a pizza crust. Bake for 20 minutes until golden. 5. Add Toppings: Spread sugar-free pizza sauce over the baked crust, then top with bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, olives, and additional 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese. 6. Bake Pizza: Return the pizza to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melty and bubbly. 7. Cool and Serve: Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
